job.title: Treasury Analyst
job.description:
The Treasury Analyst performs duties related to the organization’s cash management and cash flows. This position monitors and analyzes daily activity and forecasts for the organization. This role also provides support for special projects relevant to the organization’s treasury function.
Essential duties and responsibilities, shown below, will vary accordingly based on assignment. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
* Performs daily cash management duties including; determination of daily cash position, payment execution, investment of cash balances, and other transactions as required. * Analysis of cash data, planning and forecasting for both domestic and international operations. * Management of inter-company loans and short-term investments portfolio. * Administration and monitoring of bank reporting and transactions into Treasury Workstation. * Manages securitization cash flows. * Includes monitoring receipts, appropriate disbursement of funds, and communication between Trustee and business groups. * Supports subsidiaries in Canada, Puerto Rico, and the Virgin Islands on all cash management efforts. * Creates short-term and long term cash receipts and disbursements forecast for both domestic and international operations. * Works with internal business contacts on variance analysis to improve forecasting methodology. * Provide support as called upon on special projects as requested by management. * Responsible for monthly bank account analysis review. * Prepares and distributes Daily Treasury Reporting detailing daily treasury activity. Qualifications (may vary by level) Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
* Knowledge of Treasury workstations and PC Banking System Reporting. * Proficient in Microsoft Office applications. * Requires excellent analytical ability, attention to detail, organized, ability to multi-task and prioritize, ability to work independently and in teams, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Required Experience:
* Bachelors Degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related discipline. * Experience in Treasury, cash management, or cash-related preferred.
Travel Requirements
Minimal travel required
